Description: A narrow, triangular pendant: of mottled black and white porphyritic stone. The perforation, made from both sides, is through the widest part of the stone.
Curator's comments: For the stone cf. C. M. Firth, ‘Archaeological Survey of Nubia, 1908-9’ (Cairo, 1912),11, pl.37a, no. 5 (coarse-grained sandstone conglomerate), Early Dynastic. For the closest parallel shape among published pendants cf. G. Brunton, ‘Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture’ (London, 1937), pl.XXXIX, 89B12 (ivory), S.D.60-6.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (203)
